Requirement: A melee weapon with the Two-Handed trait.

Both hands on your weapon, you rest it on your shoulder. You widen your stance to support full-body swings, tightening your grip in anticipation.

Pros

Cleave

  • Once per turn, during your attack action, if a creature other than your target is within reach of you and within 5ft of your target, then you can make an attack against that target as well.
Called Shot
  • You take an action to prepare a strike, ending your turn. At the beginning of your next turn, you can choose to attack a target within range. This attack takes up an action, but automatically hits and is a critical hit. If you take an action or a desperate action before this, your strike is no longer prepared.
Fulcrum-Free
  • As an action, you make an attack with one hand at disadvantage, despite using a two-handed weapon.

Cons

Full Swing

  • Attack actions take up both your action and minor action.
Grasp-Free
  • If you roll a critical fail on a Fulcrum-Free attack, you drop your weapon and exit this stance.
